intro: Mammillaria buchheimiana, commonly known as the Buchheim's nipple cactus, is a compact, globular cactus native to Mexico. It features a short, cylindrical stem covered in white, woolly spines and prominent areoles. The plant produces small, yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. It is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water and well-draining soil. Due to its unique appearance and slow growth, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and cactus collections.
